review_title: A really good place to work
pros: Good pay, friendly people who want to help others and support each other, great benefits. All staff were supported incredibly through COVID-19.
cons: Sometimes there is a blame culture.

pros: Flexible shifts, Easy scripted calls, Supportive colleagues and team managers, Help with live calls, supported feedback, Really good wages, Independent training sessions always on the go for updated policy's and info, flexible break times and long lunch breaks. Remote based equipment given ( two screens )
cons: Call after call the whole shift, repetitive calls, no time to do other things as always on calls, understaffed because clients are in ques for hours, quality checks are too constructive as there is a lot of things they expect you to remember which can leave you baffled for getting marked down for minor things, no toilet breaks expected to use normal breaks for this. Old systems used which can be really slow and annoying. Holiday shifts are limited as only 2 people from each team can book a day off. This means all shifts available to book are already taken unless your lucky and must be submitted 2 weeks before or you will be declined.

review_title: Great Company and could Be an Excellent company
job_title: Contact Center Agent in Birmingham, England
pros: Salary, Great Hours, Work life balance, Great people that care about what they do. Super new offices that have just been refurbed
cons:
be more transparent, Keep staff updated, talk about the work that we do and publicize the great work that we do. 
Other companies in the sector publicize the work that they do.
Good Annual leave 
Benefits package is ok but you can pay extra to upgrade for more coverage

pros: Good job satisfaction helping people who need debt advice. Hours are good and shifts can be changed easily. Good to have a choice of working from home and in the office which has just been refurbished. Pay is ok and good opportunity to progress.
cons: The calls are fast paced and it can be stressful at times. When you come off a call a few minutes later you have to take another one. Lines are always busy.  Sick pay is very low and not much support if you go off sick. Managers don’t check on staff who could be anxious or stressed from the job.

job_title: Specialist Debt Adviser in Birmingham, England
pros: Good colleagues, and social events.
cons: Non stop workload. Extremely difficult to maintain KPI's. Very stressful. Management not interested in the concerns of employees. It is run like a boiler room call centre rather than a debt charity.

pros: Decent pay. Great colleagues. Support available. Rewarding as help people.
cons: Tiring if on the phone - call after call. Working shifts.

review_title: As good as a call center can be
pros: Feel like you're making a difference, good salary, people actually like each other at work.
cons: Call centre, difficult topics to navigate with clients, back to back calls.

pros: Advisers are lovely, office now done up so looks good. Pay good
cons: Not supportive especially if you have health issues they just expect you to deal with it and not disrupt work. Training is thrown at you all in one go and then shoved on the phones. Feel like no support from higher up.

pros: Worthwhile service offering to customers
cons: Undervalued staff working to the best of their ability

job_title: Customer Services Agent in Birmingham, England
pros: Hours were good and the team were very friendly. I enjoyed the fact I was able to help lots of customers and that the job was quite easy.
cons: There wasn’t much work to do and because I was on agency they cut the contract short for agency staff.

pros: Good people, decent salary and offices
cons: Shift patterns, targets, micro-management, rotten culture

pros: Great staff, values, job satisfaction
cons: Couldn't ask for a better place to work

pros: Friendly, Supportive, Great Team, Very social staff
cons: NONE NONE NONE NONE NONE

pros: Good location with reasonable pay for the type of work undertaken. Easy hours so good work life balance possible. Non management colleagues were really friendly and approachable.
cons: Management were not easy to communicate with as they were remote and out of the office a lot of the time. HR personnel were often unavailable due to their personal sickness / part time working hours and seemed ineffective and not at all interested when I tried to resolve an important issue.  I probably would not have left if HR had tried to help me rather than passing my issue from one colleague to another.

pros: overall I work with and alongside some lovely people. We are all committed to the cause and  passionate about helping people in debt.
cons:
management are too focussed on reaching higher for personal gain. 
no real appreciation for those that keep the services running.  
no progression for those of us with disabilities (or any other minority cone to think of it) 
exceptionally poor treatment of those with mental health problems. 
no flexibility for working parents. I have had friends forced to leave. 
clear favourites within the organisation so decisions aren't based on what is best for clients or staff. 
v high staff  turnover.

pros: Some great work colleagues and generally a friendly group of staff.  Good work/life balance.  Pay is pretty good in the contact centre, but apparently not so good in other areas.
cons: Negativity from some members of staff.  Lots of favouritism shown by Senior Management as to who gets promoted (with limited opportunity as it is).  Lack of clear direction from Management, especially the top level.  Communication generally is terrible.

pros: Good wage, great people and helping people going through financial difficulty. Knowing you are helping people makes a days work that much more enjoyable. The charity works hard on trying to influence policy and has a growing media presence. Feels as it is just going to continue to grow
cons: Although the growth is positive, sometimes too eager to implement change - don't seem to have learned how to manage change effectively.

pros: Very good pay and benefits (pension and annual leave excellent though I believe they now pay far less into pensions for new starters)
cons: Negative working environment. Management team are (on the whole) weak and ineffective and not good at 'owning the message'. Blame culture exists and some HR policies, especially around sickness absence are draconian at best. Many staff are passionate about wanting to help people but have been beaten down by the lack of trust shown in them.

pros: Some people have been there for many years and people are generally very friendly, especially the longer term staff.  Organisation viewed favourably by outside stakeholders. Excellent work life balance if you have the discipline to make it happen.  The CEO is wonderful - approachable, respected in her field and very good at involving staff.
cons: Prehistoric IT, lack of available career progression, some resistance to change. One particular Head of.

pros: good salary and rewarding work lots of training and coaching before advising clients
cons: not enough staff to take the large influx of calls meaning callers can be frustrated when they get through and this can be taken out on advisers.

review_title: Claims to be supportive, but all they do is point the finger of blame !
pros: Employee benefits, healthcare, pension, Christmas and Summer parties.
cons:
Very poor senior management, often quick to point fingers and assign blame.
HR department are terrible - inflexible and dreaming up ways to sack people, rather than helping them.

pros: Good pay, work fine and enjoyable
cons: Senior management. CEO not personable.  Also Manager rarely spoke to me and had a bad attitude.

pros: Good terms and conditions. Excellent place to work
cons: Sick pay not very good

pros: Great pay / benefits and people
cons: Shifts, 4week rotation, you get used to it.!

pros: Very flexible, great work life balance
